reviews.text: i stayed here from 13-23may2012. I have stayed at others on Rue des Ecoles and found the upgraded decor and appointments here to be money well spent. The bathroom heated towel bar was a big plus. My 3rd floor single had a balconette that opened to the street. The view was pleasant and the noise did not disturb my sleep.
reviews.title: excellent customer focus; Jennifer is a huge asset!

reviews.text: Bank, Post Office, pharmacy, grocery, phone store, restaurant, bakery, book store, entertainment and even a piscine are within blocks. Le Cathedral de Notre Dame, Luxembourg Garden, universities, museums, taxi stand, bus, Metro and RER are all within minutes.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: JENNIFER greeted me with warm recognition when i arrived in late evening, as i had informed the hotel earlier. On a daily basis, she suggested things to enhance my stay in the hotel and my enjoyment of the neighborhood and all of Paris. I improved my French vocabulary and pronounciation each time she greeted me. Her interaction with all guests was exemplary.
reviews.title: visit to Paris May 2012

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have absolutely no negative experience at this hotel. Great value, location and excellent service.
reviews.title: Breath of Fresh Air!

reviews.text: The hotel is under some renovations as we saw on our floor (a little disconcerning when getting out of the elevator).
reviews.title: Nice, clean, great staff, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved staying in the StGermain district and were able to visit many places on foot. Excellent restaurants nearby. Our room was basic, but clean and comfortable and the bed very good. Laurent the manager put us in a quiet room at the back of the hotel which was a real plus away from the noise of the front street. Having a computer to send emails and print tickets for the D'Orsay Museum was helpful and Brice happily organised a day tour for us and taxis. Jennifer and the other receptionist were also very helpful. One thing I would have liked was tea making facilities either in our room or even in the lounge area.
reviews.title: convenient hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The small rooms not as small as expected. we were close to everything and could walk or take the train or the hop on hop off bus.
reviews.title: Excellent value and excellent location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from our first trip to Paris. Stayed at the Moderne St. Germain and loved it! Yves, front desk staff, helped us arrange a side tour to Giverny and Versailles. Our room was quiet (5th floor), yet small (typical European hotel). Loved the location: close to RER and Metro, safe neighborhood, and fine restaurants. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Jennifer the best lobby staff

reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay at the Moderne St. Germain. There were four poeple in our party, so we had two rooms. With one of the rooms, we received a free upgrade to one of the renovated rooms. Both rooms were nice and clean, but the renovated room was nicer and more spacious. The older room had a blue bedspread and an older headboard and desk. It also had a closet with a safe. The newer room had sleek white bedding with a duvet and thin throw across the foot of the bed. It also had a silver, sleek headboard with built in lighting for reading. The beside tables weren't drawers but more like cubicles with a sliding door to open. There was a modern desk and chair and a pretty spacious closet for European standards. Unlike the older room, the renovated room had new tile, a rainhead shower, a towel warmer and nice toiletries. Both rooms had modern flat screen tvs and consistent, good, free wi-fi.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There's also a computer in the lobby that worked well. It also has Skype on it so you can use your Skye account to call home. They were doing some construction nearby so you could hear that each morning, but it didn't wake me from my sleep.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet had cold foods: yogurt, pastries, cold cut meats, cheese, jams, juices and coffee. So it was light, but enough to carry you through lunch.
reviews.title: citytrip

reviews.text: The staff, espcially Brice, was very helpful. They called cabs, arranged shuttles and were all around friendly and nice.
reviews.title: Good location, clean, modern rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In terms of location, we were mere blocks from all the action. Walk four to five blocks and you're at the Seine and Notre Dame. You're right in the heart of the Latin Quarter with metro, buses, hop on hop off tours and a cab stand all nearby. There are a number of restaurants on the street as well. We would return and book an upgraded room.
reviews.title: Great value for money!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They are still "modernizing" the Hotel so I guess your experience depends on your room! #50 on 5th flr as someone else said the rooms at the ends of the corridor seem to be roomier. Hardwood floor in my room but was not bothered much by noise from other rooms..just other guests occasionally a bit too noisy in the hallway!
reviews.title: A work in progress

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had requested a bath tub rather than just shower..asked again when given key...no tub for 44 so given 50. Flat screen TV, electronic safe, minibar, CNN, very good breakfast room and variety of foods totally self service so no waiting for one harried person to bring your cafe and it was included in room rate!
reviews.title: Ask for the 12!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Construction ongoing in hotel and a major site next door at the Hotel Sully..began work faithfully every day but Sun at 8 until about 5 but not a problem. One day room was still being cleaned when returned at about 4 but 5 mins and he was done, after taking a moment to provide more rolls of tp and box of tissues!
reviews.title: Good location, good price, but not a good sleep

reviews.text: If you are looking for French country decor or Louis 14, 15 or 16..this is not your place.
reviews.title: All the nice rooms are full
